section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਅੰਤਰਿ ਮੈਲੁ ਜੇ ਤੀਰਥ ਨਾਵੈ ਤਿਸੁ ਬੈਕੁੰਠ ਨ ਜਾਨਾਂ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: With filth within the heart, even if one bathes at sacred places of pilgrimage, still, he shall not go to heaven.

transliteration.text: antar mail jē tīrath nāvai tis baikunth n jānānh .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਲੋਕ ਪਤੀਣੇ ਕਛੂ ਨ ਹੋਵੈ ਨਾਹੀ ਰਾਮੁ ਅਯਾਨਾ ॥੧॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Nothing is gained by trying to please others - the Lord cannot be fooled. ||1||

transliteration.text: lōk patīnē kashū n hōvai nāhī rām ayānā .1.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਸਾਚਾ ਨਾਵਣੁ ਗੁਰ ਕੀ ਸੇਵਾ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The true cleansing bath is service to the Guru. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: sāchā nāvan gur kī sēvā .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. text: ਜਲ ਕੈ ਮਜਨਿ ਜੇ ਗਤਿ ਹੋਵੈ ਨਿਤ ਨਿਤ ਮੇਂਡੁਕ ਨਾਵਹਿ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: If salvation can be obtained by bathing in water, then what about the frog, which is always bathing in water?

transliteration.text: jal kai majan jē gat hōvai nit nit mēnhduk nāvah .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. text: ਜੈਸੇ ਮੇਂਡੁਕ ਤੈਸੇ ਓਇ ਨਰ ਫਿਰਿ ਫਿਰਿ ਜੋਨੀ ਆਵਹਿ ॥੨॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: As is the frog, so is that mortal; he is reincarnated, over and over again. ||2||

transliteration.text: jaisē mēnhduk taisē ōi nar phir phir jōnī āvah .2.

text: ਮਨਹੁ ਕਠੋਰੁ ਮਰੈ ਬਾਨਾਰਸਿ ਨਰਕੁ ਨ ਬਾਂਚਿਆ ਜਾਈ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: If the hard-hearted sinner dies in Benaares, he cannot escape hell.

transliteration.text: manah kathōr marai bānāras narak n bānhchiā jāī .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. text: ਹਰਿ ਕਾ ਸੰਤੁ ਮਰੈ ਹਾੜੰਬੈ ਤ ਸਗਲੀ ਸੈਨ ਤਰਾਈ ॥੩॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: And even if the Lord's Saint dies in the cursed land of Haramba, still, he saves all his family. ||3||

transliteration.text: har kā sant marai hāranbai t sagalī sain tarāī .3.

text: ਦਿਨਸੁ ਨ ਰੈਨਿ ਬੇਦੁ ਨਹੀ ਸਾਸਤ੍ਰ ਤਹਾ ਬਸੈ ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰਾ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Where there is neither day nor night, and neither Vedas nor Shaastras, there, the Formless Lord abides.

transliteration.text: dinas n rain bēd nahī sāsatr tahā basai nirankārā .

text: ਕਹਿ ਕਬੀਰ ਨਰ ਤਿਸਹਿ ਧਿਆਵਹੁ ਬਾਵਰਿਆ ਸੰਸਾਰਾ ॥੪॥੪॥੩੭॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, meditate on Him, O mad-men of the world. ||4||4||37||

transliteration.text: kah kabīr nar tisah dhiāvah bāvariā sansārā .4.4.37.
